value.title: Administer Power BI, Part 2 - Premium, Power BI embedded, automation
value.excerpt: As an administrator, how do you foster collaboration and share Power BI outputs? How do you monitor and audit usage, build a data access infrastructure, and automate administration? This course will demonstrate how Power BI Premium manages capacity resources. You‚Äôll learn how to establish a data access infrastructure and how to share Power BI reports beyond your Power BI tenant. Finally, you‚Äôll learn how to automate common tasks with Microsoft Power BI Cmdlets for Windows PowerShell and PowerShell core.

topItems.title: Provision Premium capacity in Power BI
topItems.excerpt: Learn about the differences between Power BI Pro and Power BI Premium, and how Power BI Premium manages capacity resources.

topItems.title: Establish a data access infrastructure in Power BI
topItems.excerpt: Learn how to establish a data access infrastructure for accessing all your data within Power BI.

topItems.title: Broaden the reach of Power BI
topItems.excerpt: Learn the various ways to share Power BI reports beyond your Power BI tenant.

topItems.title: Automate Power BI administration
topItems.excerpt: Common manual tasks can be automated with Microsoft Power BI Cmdlets for Windows PowerShell and PowerShell core.

value.title: Administer Power BI, Part 2 - Tenants, governance, collaboration
value.excerpt: Power BI administrators manage every aspect of their tenant. This learning path covers advanced administrative tasks, such as fostering collaboration and sharing data. You will earn how to monitor and audit usage, build a data access infrastructure, broaden the reach of Power BI, and automate administration with APIs and PowerShell cmdlets.

topItems.title: Provision Premium capacity in Power BI

topItems.excerpt: Learn how to establish a data access infrastructure for accessing all your data within Power BI.

topItems.title: Broaden the reach of Power BI
topItems.excerpt: Learn the various ways to share Power BI reports beyond your Power BI tenant.

topItems.title: Automate Power BI administration
topItems.excerpt: Common manual tasks can be automated with Microsoft Power BI Cmdlets for Windows PowerShell and PowerShell core.

value.title: Architect solutions for Dynamics 365 and Power Platform
value.excerpt:
A Solution Architect is responsible for the successful design, implementation, deployment, and adoption of an overall solution. A Solution Architect ensures that the solution meets the customer‚Äôs needs now and in the future. While the Solution Architect may not ‚Äúclick the buttons‚Äù during a deployment, they are ultimately responsible for the solution and work closely with the deployment team.
This learning path covers the pre-sales and analysis phases of a project to include:

What it takes to become a Solution Architect.
Discovering customer needs.
Proposing a solution.
Working with requirements.
Performing fit-gap analysis.

Instructor-led training (ILT) is scheduled for March 2020 that provides more hands-on activities and both this path and ILT are needed for the exam.

topItems.title: Becoming a solution architect for Dynamics 365 and Power Platform
topItems.excerpt: Learn how to become a solution architect.

topItems.title: Discover customer needs as a Solution Architect for Dynamics 365 and Power Platform
topItems.excerpt: Learn how to ask customers questions about their business processes and feature requirements to create a viable solution.

topItems.title: Propose a solution as a Solution Architect for Power Platform and Dynamics 365
topItems.excerpt: Learn how to propose a solution.

topItems.title: Work with requirements as a solution architect for Microsoft Power Platform and Dynamics 365
topItems.excerpt: It is important to capture the customer‚Äôs needs accurately. This module explains how to capture requirements and identify functional and non-functional items.

value.title: Empower modern analytics and business intelligence data cultures with Excel, Power BI, MS Teams, and SharePoint
value.excerpt: Excel is a Microsoft application that has been in use since 1985. You might be surprised that in addition to simple spreadsheets, Excel can enable modern analytics and business intelligence. In this Learning Path, you will learn how to modernize and empower data conversations within your organization using Excel & Power BI together with MS Teams, and SharePoint. You‚Äôll gain awareness of the business intelligence landscape, technology capabilities, and their roles.

topItems.title: Introduction to modern analytics using Excel and Power BI
topItems.excerpt: This module introduces the Microsoft modern analytics core suite of tools, including Office 365/Excel 2016+, Power Query, Data Model, Power BI Desktop, and Power BI service. By using modern analytics technologies, you and your organization can work faster, more efficiently, and smarter by using Excel together with Power BI.

topItems.title: Automate data cleaning with Power Query
topItems.excerpt: This module introduces Power Query in Microsoft Excel, a powerful data connection, cleaning, and shaping technology that is a core part of the Microsoft modern analytics suite of business intelligence tools.

topItems.title: Introduction to foundations in data modeling
topItems.excerpt: This module introduces the key concepts that are related to developing a well-organized data model.

topItems.title: Transition from Excel to Power BI
topItems.excerpt: Microsoft's Power BI combines the Power Query's extraction, transformation, and loading capabilities with DAX and a relational data model in a new application with new features.

value.title: How to build a dashboard
value.excerpt: How to build a dashboard

value.title: Design a data¬†model¬†in Power BI¬†
value.excerpt: The process of creating a complicated data model in Power BI is straightforward. If your data is coming in from more than one transactional system, before you know it, you can have dozens of tables that you have to work with. Building a great data model is about simplifying the disarray. A star schema is one way to simplify a data model, and you‚Äôll learn about the terminology and implementation of them in this module. You will also learn about why choosing the correct data granularity is important for performance and usability of your Power BI reports. Finally, you‚Äôll learn about improving performance with your Power BI data models.

value.title: Page Level Security workaround in Power BI
value.excerpt: If you want to control the access to the Power BI report pages (or tabs) in a way that some users see some pages, and some others see other pages, we need something called page-level security. However, Power BI, as of today, doesn‚Äôt support visual-level or page-level security. There is a workaround to
value.featuredContent: <iframe width="800" height="500" frameborder="0" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/an7n2kSTBk0" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

value.title: Power BI From and To Date Filtering with One Slicer
value.excerpt: It happens that you might have two fields as From and To date (or Start and End date) in your dataset, and you want a date slicer in the report. The date slicer has to filter records in a way that the FROM and the TO dates are in the range of dates selected in the slicer. There are multiple ways of doing
